Pixie Lifespan Tests
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Research on game mechanics: Pixie Lifespan Tests
By Harrabcat on Sunday, December 21, 2003 - 12:42 am:

Ok Yesterday I asked Lisa how to go about doing lifespan tests and today I got done with the first half. I suspect tomorrow I will get done with the second half but heres the first half.

Ok I raised 5 pure pixies,2 of them were from Combining, 1 of them was from the encyclepedia, and the last 2 were from Cd's (Official playstation magazine #33.) I fed them potatos their whole entire life at a regular schedule (I fed them every 4th week until they got chubby then I had to feed them every 2nd and 4th week) All the pixies were born on the 1st week in February. I had no items in my inventory but the food I was feeding them and the only gadget I had out was the great barn and the great house. Heres the results


NameCreated by 2nd stage 3rd stage 4th stage 5th stage Retired
T1Combining10mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk
T2Combining10mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk
T3Encyclepedia10mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk
T4CD10mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk
T5CD10mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk

T1,T3,T5 Had not serious temper
T2 had nice temper
T4 had normal temper

As you can see NOTHING HAPPENED... It doesn't matter if you make a monster by encyclepedia, book, or by combining the lifespan seems to be the same.. now this next series of test should be funner

Any questions or comments?

By Harrabcat on Sunday, December 21, 2003 - 10:25 am:

The 2 combined pixies were both from encyclepedia entries that were untrained.

By Harrabcat on Sunday, December 21, 2003 - 11:13 am:

By Harrabcat on Sunday, December 21, 2003 - 09:07 pm:

Ok, I combined T4 and T5 Today and found some interesting results..

NamePOWLIFINTACCDEFSPD
T4608018012075155
T5608018012075155
Resulting Baby799522015571194

T4 and T5 had the bonding lvl of Great friends

These pixies weren't trained at all during thier whole entire life and yet they made a baby with better stats in all areas except defense.

Ok Finished second half Heres the full chart

T3Enc.Potato2/110mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk
T4CdPotato2/110mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk
T5CdPotato2/110mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk
T6ComboPotato8/110mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk
T7ComboVitamins8/110mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk
T8Enc.Potato8/110mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk

T10CdPork8/110mo1wk1yr11mo2wk3yr0mo3wk3yr10mo3wk4yr2mo0wk

T1, T3, T5, T7, T9, and T10 had not serious tempers
T4, T6, and T8 had normal tempers
T2 had a nice temper

As you can see Nothing happened!!! It doesn't matter if you create a monster by combining, encyclepedia, or by cd, nor does it what time of year you create the monster in. It doesn't even matter what type of food you feed the monster, as long as it stays healthy. Kinda makes you wonder what does matter..

Any questions comments or the likewise?

By Raistlin_Majere on Tuesday, December 23, 2003 - 12:28 am:

almost forgot also tried it with 5 pure breed hengers (from encyclopedia)... had a bit of different results though (just fed it mushrooms)... retired them at 4 years and 4 months...will try it again later since i could go home early today from work :D

By Raistlin_Majere on Tuesday, December 23, 2003 - 07:09 pm:

okay just for a bit of info for anonymous and help for harrabcat (it still requires a much more thorough testing). Yesterday, as i was testing my hengers I tried battling a henger once to see if i would have a lifespan loss and rested the others. I didn't had a lifespan loss. All of the hengers were retired on the same week at 4 years and 4 months.

The test I made for the henger was like this. Loaded up the game where the hengers are at 5th stage (when it says that it needs to be retired soon). And entered one of the five hengers i'm testing in a rank E event. After the battle continued resting all of the hengers until they are forced to retire. I ended up with all of them retiring on the same week.

Note: I just tested this once. Will continue to test this again later.
